newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says Q3 joblessness down to 7.0 pct vs yr-ago.
newsitem.headline: Peru says Q3 joblessness down to 7.0 pct vs yr-ago.

text.p: The Peruvian jobless rate was 7.0 percent in the third quarter of last year, down from 7.6 percent in the same period of 1995, the Labor Ministry said Monday.
Among age groups, the highest unemployment rate, 12.7 percent, was among youths between 14 and 24 years old.
The worst affected area, with 11.2 percent unemployment, was the northern highland zone of Peru.
The ministry began last year basing its unemployment figure on surveys throughout the country. The government's previous methodology had only collected data from the capital Lima.
Third quarter 1996 unemployment for men was 6.4 percent, down from 6.0 percent last year, while for women the rate fell to 7.9 percent from 10.1 percent.
Peru also has an underemployment rate of around 47 percent, according to government officials, with many in that figure employed in the informal economy.
